channel.title: What is a famous server's base?
channel.description:
Hello all,
I would just like to know what base do famous rsps's use like SoulSplit, or NearReality, or Ikov. I want to follow in their footsteps :P :D :)
Looking forward to a response.

item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Pure_:

They probably write their own, beware though, having a famous server doesn’t mean your code is worth two shits.

Well put. And also, if they didn’t write their own, chances are they’ve changed the base so much it could be considered their own.

Base that they all use - A version of Runescape. Badum Ts

Read full topic

item.title: What is a famous server's base?
item.dc:creator: @fuzzout fuzzout
item.description:
@fuzzout wrote:

So my view on this…

It is all personal choice. Every source can be adapted, changed, improved and up-graded/dated to the point where it cannot be recognized by people that play on the server; and that is ideally what you should do… Go with something you feel comfortable with, learn its nooks and crannies and eventually it will become like your own room within which you know where everything is located. Remember, no source is set in stone… Just because you downloaded PI or Testscape, doesn’t mean it will have to have the same weaknesses as the original. It is up to you to mould it and make it your own, better source.

Plus, if you worry about stability, I wouldn’t. There’s not that many players out there… And should your server get above 100 population, well; this is where you can think about server structure improvements… Until that time; practice, practice, practice.

Read full topic
item.source: What is a famous server's base?

item.title: What is a famous server's base?
item.dc:creator: @AliAbid AliAbid
item.description:
@AliAbid wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:19, topic:541272”][quote author=AliAbid link=topic=660143.msg4414865#msg4414865 date=1395416180]
So what doesnt suck that is good for beginners? What Im developing right now is delta because it is the easiest.
[/quote]
To be honest, when I started using Hyperion as a beginner, I pretty much learned the most rather than when I used delta, PI, and allstar for 2 years. In my 4 months I learned more than 2 years. Haha.[/quote]

Thanks, I might start with a bit of delta because its the only one that i know at least a few things about, and to get a little more background knowledge and move straight into hyperion.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a famous server's base?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Near-Reality used Shard-Revolutions
SoulSplit used Project Insanity
Ikov used Project Insanity

Do not use any of these bases, they suck.

Read full topic
item.source: What is a famous server's base?

item.title: What is a famous server's base?
item.dc:creator: @Titanium1 Titanium_
item.description:
@Titanium1 wrote:

Pure_:

They probably write their own, beware though, having a famous server doesn’t mean your code is worth two shits.

I could be wrong but, when the NR leak was released not to long ago, the source was Shards by Graham. The leak of Arrav(Zarketh) that was released on r-s was a custom source. Not sure about the soulsplit source right now but last time I checked, it was based off of PI. Though you are for sure correct on the fact “Having a famous server doesn’t mean your code is worth two shits”. For all you would want, you could have a server running off of deltascape and people could probably still find a way to hit 150+ players still these days.

Read full topic
item.source: What is a famous server's base?

please do something DIFFERENT, what base they used is irrelevant

Get your Asteria base done.
[/quote]
its a lot of work for one dude[/quote]

item.title: What is a famous server's base?
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:6, topic:541272”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=660143.msg4414062#msg4414062 date=1394997709]
They probably write their own, beware though, having a famous server doesn’t mean your code is worth two shits.
[/quote]
Agreed, though I think alot of them use PI.

ok thanks for the advice guys. So, that means there is something like a good PI right?

Just because a server is “famous” doesn’t mean its “good”. The code could even suck.

Justin Bieber is famous, doesn’t automatically mean his songs are good.

I’ve worked for SoulSplit with Ryley(AtomicInt_). Ryley got more close to their server developer(arrowz_flame). I remember that he told me that their initial base was a PI server. However, they improved it a ton.

I remember Ryley telling me, when I asked him, if Hyperion or Soulsplit is better code-wise, he told me Hyperion still wins. Lol.

feels like a lot of those servers have the same shitty feel of project insanity

Ikr

“Improving” PI is like putting air freshener on poop, its still poop trying to smell good.[/quote]
I never said that SS was amazing.

Read full topic
item.source: What is a famous server's base?
